meanings.definition: To yield or surrender to the will or authority of another.
meanings.sent1: I will submit to my teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: Please submit your homework by the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: I had to submit to my little sister's demands for the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The tree had to submit to the force of the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: He had no choice but to submit to the king's command.

meanings.definition: To present for consideration or approval.
meanings.sent1: She will submit her project proposal to the committee.
meanings.sent2: You need to submit your application before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: I decided to submit my crazy idea for a new invention.
meanings.sent4: The artist will submit his painting to the art competition.
meanings.sent5: He was nervous to submit his speech for the public speaking contest.

meanings.definition: To subject to a particular process or treatment.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will submit the sample to rigorous testing.
meanings.sent2: You must submit your application for review.
meanings.sent3: I had to submit my phone to a software update.
meanings.sent4: The metal will submit to intense heat during the forging process.
meanings.sent5: She had to submit her manuscript to multiple edits before publishing.
